page.title: About
page.content:
America’s Home Improvement Lender of Choice

Over two decades of experience in home improvement lending means we’ve developed products and services designed to meet the specific needs of homeowners and contractors alike. Stable and secure, we’re the premier lender for home improvement projects, seeing continual growth through multiple economic cycles.

memberFdic.fdicDescription:
Member FDIC Bank

Why should home improvement professionals work with a regulated FDIC-insured bank, like EnerBank?

  • Funding isn’t an issue — Contractors get paid early in the process, with no long-term issues, because you’re working with the actual lender. As a balance sheet lender, we have direct access to the capital required for funding your requests. This means your cash flow is never interrupted – you’ll always get paid whether the economy is up or down.
  • Confidence — Being a regulated bank means the FDIC ensures EnerBank is subject to federal financial regulations. That’s real oversight — you can be confident we’ll do what we say, because we’re government-regulated.
  • Trust — When you work with a regulated bank, you know exactly who to talk to if something goes wrong. EnerBank provides you a dedicated relationship manager, so if any issues ever arise, they can mediate the situation and make sure it all works out.

As a regulated Member FDIC bank, we can offer loans with no hidden fees, and a variety of loan products to meet your customers’ needs.

about.cmsEnergy:
CMS Energy

EnerBank is a wholly-owned subsidiary of CMS Energy Corporation (NYSE: CMS). CMS Energy is committed to clean energy through its Consumers Energy and CMS Enterprises subsidiaries, which together are the largest source of electric and gas services in Michigan. The company owns and operates wind and solar projects nationwide, and strives each day to fulfill its purpose of World Class Performance Delivering Hometown Service, and measures its success through a triple bottom line focused on People, Planet and Profit.

communityInvolvement.ciBrif: EnerBank USA is not just an office building full of workers, we’re a meaningful part of the community in more ways than one. Our leaders and team members dedicate their time to enrich the lives of people in our community through volunteer hours spent in a variety of good causes, such as:

directors.directorDescription:
Rob Palmer has overall responsibility for Operations and IT at EnerBank. Rob also serves as the Chairman of the IT Committee.

Rob has worked for EnerBank since 2012. Prior to joining EnerBank, he held various leadership positions in the Financial Services and Technology industries. He has over 25 years' experience delivering people-based, technology-driven solutions.

Rob is a native Floridian. He earned a B.S. in Computer Information Systems from Florida Tech.
directors.directorOverlay: Rob Palmer has overall responsibility for Operations and IT at EnerBank. Rob also serves as the Chairman of the IT Committee.
directors.directorPosition: Executive Vice President & Bank Operations Manager

directors.directorDescription:
Blaine Bagley manages a team of operations professionals, including customer service, collections, contractor services, customer relations, lending operation services and human resources.

Previously, he was Vice President and Manager of Loan Operations, where his responsibilities included the lending and collections departments. Blaine has over 25 years of banking and financial services experience. He joined EnerBank in 2005 after ten years as the Group Vice President and Director of Collections for American Investment Bank, NA, a nationally chartered bank, where he oversaw the operations of the auto and recreational loan portfolios.

Blaine is also active in his local community serving on the board of the Suazo Business Center. The Suazo Business Center is a business resource committed to the economic empowerment of the Latino/Hispanic and other underserved communities in the State of Utah.

Blaine completed his general education and studied Political Science at Utah State University (1989).

directors.directorDescription:
Charles E. Knadler is responsible for the overall management of EnerBank. He was named to the position on January 1, 2016.

Prior to his current position, Charlie was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer from 2010 through the end of 2015 and Senior Vice President and Chief Credit Officer from 2005 to 2010. His career in financial services started in 1994 and ncludes xperience in sales, credit, compliance and finance. Prior to joining EnerBank, he managed the home improvement credit department at Associates First Capital Corporation.

Charlie previously served as president of the Utah Association of Financial Services and vice-president of the National Association of Industrial Banks. Both organizations have a mission to advocate for policies that expand access to credit, guarantee consumer choice, and provide unique banking services.

Charlie has donated his time and expertise to NeighborWorks Salt Lake for over five years. NeighborWorks Salt Lake works to revitalize neighborhoods house by house, block by block by building on the strength of neighborhoods, creating opportunities through housing and resident leadership, and contributing to the development of the youth and local economy. He has served on their finance committee since 2013, was added to their board of directors in 2017 and currently serves on their executive committee.

Born in Baltimore, Maryland, Charlie earned his undergraduate degree from Brigham Young University and MBA from the University of Utah.
directors.directorOverlay: Charles E. Knadler is responsible for the overall management of EnerBank.

directors.directorDescription:
Joel Cannon is Senior Vice President, Sales and Marketing at EnerBank USA.

He has overall responsibility for the bank’s new business development, contractor and sponsor account management, product development, marketing, contractor training and sales training. He manages a team of over 50 industry professionals that serve the needs of the bank’s ~10,000 strategic partners in the home improvement industry.

Joel joined EnerBank as Vice President of Training in 2015 and served as Vice President and Manager, Marketing Division from 2016-2019. Prior to joining EnerBank, Joel served in various marketing, sales, and product leadership roles within Utah based transportation, marketing, and technology companies.

Joel has served as past chairman and Executive Board Member at People Helping People since 2011, and a volunteer coach since 2006. Utah based non-profit, People Helping People helps families break the cycle of poverty by providing career education, coaching, and mentorships for low-income women, primarily single mothers.

Originally from Utah, Joel attended the University of Utah and is a 2016 graduate of the Utah Bankers Association’s Executive Development Program.
directors.directorOverlay: Joel Cannon is Senior Vice President, Sales and Marketing at EnerBank USA.

directors.directorDescription:
Prior to her current position, Kristin served as Executive Vice President of Finance and Credit, and Senior Vice President and Chief Credit Officer at EnerBank from 2010 to 2015.

Prior to joining EnerBank, Kristin was the Chief Credit Officer at BMW Bank of North America. She began her banking career as a Financial Examiner with the Utah Department of Financial Institutions. In this capacity, she conducted extensive onsite examinations of both large and small state-chartered community banks, industrial banks, and credit unions.

Kristin serves on the Advisory Board of the Eccles Opportunity Scholars Program at the University of Utah and enjoys mentoring affiliated first-generation college students. Kristin joined the Board of the Utah Bankers Association in 2016 and is honored to be serving as its 2020-2021 Chair. Utah Business Magazine selected Kristin as one of 30 Women to Watch in 2016.

Kristin holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance and a Master of Business Administration degree, both awarded by the University of Utah.

directors.directorDescription:
Neil R. Fellows’ responsibilities include managing EnerBank’s Legal & Compliance Department and serving as chairman of its CRA and Compliance Committee. Neil has been with EnerBank since 2014.

Prior to joining EnerBank, Neil held various legal positions at CMS Energy Corporation (the parent company of EnerBank) and its affiliates from 1987 to 2013 where he specialized in energy related transactional and regulatory matters.

Neil currently serves as a Director on the Board of Directors of Junior Achievement of Utah. Junior Achievement of Utah was established in 1956 to educate Utah's students in work readiness, entrepreneurship, and financial literacy through experiential, hands-on programs. In 2020 he was named a Corporate Counsel of the Year honoree by Utah Business Magazine.

Neil was born in England and raised in Michigan. He earned a B.S. in Business from Central Michigan University and a J.D. from Wayne State University Law School. He is licensed to practice law in Michigan and Utah.

directors.directorDescription:
Robb Kerry is responsible for all aspects of consumer and commercial credit risk at EnerBank. Robb is also responsible for the bank's Enterprise Risk Management program.

Prior to his current position, Robb was at GE Capital Bank where he spent 5 years as the Models and Quantitative Risk Leader, where he oversaw all aspects of credit modeling and portfolio stress testing. Robb has also been Chief Credit Officer at both ADB Bank and Cache Valley Bank. He began his banking career as a Financial Examiner for the Utah Department of Financial Institutions.

Robb received his Master of Business Administration and Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration and Spanish from Weber State University. He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst® designation. Robb joined EnerBank in 2015.

EnerBank Board of Directors

We benefit greatly from the combined experience of our Board of Directors as we continue to become the most sought-after home improvement lender in the nation.

members.memberDescription: Rejji P. Hayes is the chairman of the board of EnerBank USA and was named to this position in 2018. Mr. Hayes also serves as executive vice president and chief financial officer of CMS Energy, EnerBank USA’s parent company. He was named to this position in 2017. In this role, Mr. Hayes is responsible for treasury, tax, investor relations, accounting, financial planning, internal controls and compliance, as well as mergers & acquisitions.Mr. Hayes previously served as chief financial officer for ITC Holdings Corp. from 2014 to 2016. At ITC, Mr. Hayes was responsible for the company’s accounting, tax, mergers and acquisitions, internal audit, investor relations, treasury, financial planning and analysis, management reporting and risk management functions. He has also held strategy and financial leadership roles for Exelon Corporation, Lazard Frères & Co., Banc of America Securities and Merrill Lynch. He also serves on the boards of the Detroit Zoological Society and Michigan Chamber of Commerce, and Cranbrook Educational Community.Mr. Hayes earned an MBA from Harvard Business School and a bachelor’s degree from Amherst College.

members.memberDescription:
Louise P. Kelly is a banking industry leader and respected national advocate. Her banking career has spanned nearly 50 years, including positions with Riggs National Bank, Signet Bank and First National Bank of Maryland, in addition to being the retired president & CEO of EnerBankUSA. As such, she possesses a richness of experience with EnerBank’s unique business plan.

Ms. Kelly previously served as president of the Utah Association of Financial Services, an executive committee member of the National Association of Industrial Bankers, chairman of the Utah Bankers Association, a governor-appointed member of the Utah State Financial Institutions Advisory Board, member of the prestigious ABA Government Relations Committee and director of Salt Lake City-based not-for-profit organization, People Helping People. She is a recipient of the Utah Bankers Association’s Distinguished Banker Award and was named one of the 25 Most Powerful Women in Finance by American Banker.Ms. Kelly attended St. Mary’s Junior College (Raleigh, NC) and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

members.memberDescription: Daniel T. Lis has enjoyed a 30-year career in banking, including senior leadership positions at a publicly-held bank holding company. He has specialized in legal, corporate governance and public and governmental affairs. Following retirement, Mr. Lis served ten years in a senior leadership position as general counsel and corporate secretary of a publicly-held international staffing firm. He currently serves as president of a private charitable foundation. Mr. Lis earned a bachelor of science in economics from John Carroll University, MBA specializing in finance from University of Toledo, and juris doctor from University of Detroit Mercy School of Law. He is a member of the Michigan Bar Association. “It’s been an extraordinary experience to serve as an independent director and watch the management team grow EnerBank USA into a leading home improvement lender serving contractors and homeowners with first-of-its-kind products and outstanding service as it seeks to be the most sought-after lender in the home improvement industry.”

members.memberDescription:
Srikanth (Sri) Maddipati is Vice President, Treasurer and Investor Relations for CMS Energy and its principal subsidiary, Consumers Energy. He was elected to the position in 2016. He is responsible for managing corporate liquidity, financing and treasury operations, and maintaining relationships with investors, banks and rating agencies.

He also is a member of the Benefit Administration Committee, which is responsible for the investment management of the employee benefit plans, including pension, 401(k), health care and life insurance.

Mr. Maddipati joined CMS Energy in 2014 as Assistant Treasurer. In this position, Mr. Maddipati was credited with improving the company’s financial ratings and rating-agency relationships and reducing operating costs.He previously served as a Vice President in the Financial Institutions Group, Investment Banking, at Goldman Sachs in New York,N.Y.

Mr. Maddipati earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering, and master’s degrees in engineering and business administration, from the University of Michigan.
members.memberOverlay: Srikanth (Sri) Maddipati is Vice President, Treasurer and Investor Relations for CMS

members.memberDescription:
Patrick M. McQueen is a founding board member, joining the EnerBank board of directors in 2002. He joined McQueen Financial Advisors (MFA) in 2011. MFA provides investment advice, asset/liability management analysis, mortgage servicing rights valuations and consulting on a number of banking topics. As part of the consulting group, Mr. McQueen provides strategic advice and expert witness reports and testimony for clients such as law firms representing federal regulators and others in civil actions

Mr. McQueen has also been on the board of directors for Grow Michigan, LLC, since 2017, where he is chair of theaudit committee. From 1999 to 2011, he served in a variety of capacities at The PrivateBank, including chairman, CEO, and president. He has been chairman of the Michigan Gaming Control Board since 2012, and is a former Michigan Commissioner of Insurance. As governor-appointed commissioner of the Michigan Financial Institutions Bureau from 1993 to 1999, he was responsible for the regulatory oversight of 140 state-chartered banks, 350 credit unions and all regulated non-depository lenders.

Mr. McQueen earned his BBA at University of Michigan, Dearborn, and his MBA at Michigan State University.

members.memberDescription:
Laura Mountcastle served as vice president of investor relations, and treasurer for CMS Energy, from 1994 to 2012, responsible for relations with investors, rating agencies and financial institutions, financing and cash management. Her career has taken her to established energy and financial organizations across the country, from financial analyst and director of investor relations at PG&E Corp. in San Francisco from 1984 to 1994, to Chemical Bank in New York City in 1980 to 1982. Ms. Mountcastle earned her BA in economics from Trinity College, Hartford, CT; and an MBA from Yale School of Management. She is a former co-chair of the Edison Electric Institute Treasurers Group and member of the American Gas Association Treasurers Group.

“It’s exciting to be on the board of directors for EnerBank USA. The company’s long track record of growth has been accomplished while maintaining strong credit and risk management, quality products and a supportive and inclusive culture. I bring to the board my financial skills, knowledge of the financial and credit markets, and experience with EnerBank while working at CMS Energy.”

Joseph M. Walsh serves as president and CEO of Legacy DMC, which oversees financial and mission-continuation commitments relating to Vanguard Health Systems’ 2010 purchase of Detroit Medical Center hospitals. As a business consultant, Mr. Walsh’s clients included CMS Energy,and the Detroit Mayor’s Office.

At CMS Energy, Mr. Walsh played a key role in developing corporate governance programs, including design and implementation of the Sarbanes-Oxley financial reporting systems for monitoring compliance with regulatory requirements. He also contributed to the development of enterprise risk management and business continuity processes. Previously, he worked for 30 years at Ford Motor Company in financial and operational assignments,including vice president for credit policy at Ford Credit and president of Ford Credit Asia-Pacific.

Mr. Walsh currently serves as the secretary of the Lingap Children’s Foundation. He has previously served on the boards of the Homeless Action Network of Detroit, the Michigan Science Center, and the Health Authority of Detroit Wayne County.. Mr. Walsh earned his MBA from University of Detroit Mercy, where he has been inducted into the Hall of Honor of its College of Business.

Leonard E. Wiatr previously served as executive managing director and chief risk officer for The PrivateBank, and was a member of the executive committee. In this role, he was responsible for the development and execution of the enterprise risk management program and managing regulatory affairs, and oversaw the compliance and loan review departments.Mr. Wiatr has also served at ABN AMRO and its subsidiary, LaSalle Bank Corp., as executive vice president, where his duties included developing and implementing an enterprise-wide compliance program. Prior to that, Mr. Wiatr held the role of examiner-in-charge for large bank supervision for the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency. His responsibilities included examining large and mid-size banking institutions and reporting to the board of directors on regulatory issues.

He serves on various community and civic boards, including St. Anthony’s Hospital, Catholic Charities of Chicago, and the Illinois Patrons of the Arts in the Vatican Museums. Mr. Wiatr received his BBA from St. Joseph’s College, in Rensselaer, Indiana and is a graduate of the University of Wisconsin Graduate School of Banking.
